chapter.title: Support Request Manager
chapter.para: One of the CodeX goals is to help project team to grow a community of users and developers around their project. The Support Request (SR) service is one of the communication mechanisms offered by CodeX between the community of users and the project team. The SR service allows any CodeX user to post a question to the project team. SRs are primarily intended for technical question about the software itself or its usage.

Since the SR service is entirely Web based any CodeX user can follow the thread of discussions between the other users and the project team. It is also possible to review all the SRs that were posted in the past and the answer given by the project team. With the Support Request service a project team can easily and efficient coordinate technical support activities.

section.title: Support Request Submission
section.para: Anyone is allowed to submit a Support Request. To submit a SR to a given project, first go to the Project Summary page (see ) and then select either the "Support" item from the Project Main Menu in the upper part of the page or the "Support Request" item from the Public Area.

From there you enter the SR Manager and the first screen you are faced with is the SR selection and browsing screen (more about this facility in ). For now let's click on the "Submit a Request" item from the SR Manager Menu Bar in the upper part of the welcome screen (see ).

tip.title: Tip: make sure your SR hasn't yet been submitted
tip.para: About to submit a support request to a CodeX Project? Before you do that, make sure that a similar SR hasn't yet been submitted by others. To do so you can either browse the SR database through the SR Selection and Browsing possibly using the Category criteria to narrow the number of selected SRs.

section.para: Select the category that is most appropriate to your request. Fill the Summary and the Description fields giving as much detail as possible like the version of the software you are using, the machine it runs on, etc. Then submit your request by clicking on the "Submit Request" button.

section.title: Support Request Browsing
section.para: The Support Request Manager is organized like the Bug Tracking System or the Task Manager. To access the welcome screen click on the "Support" item in the Project Main Menu available at the top of the Project Summary page.

From this screen you can select a set of support requests that match a set of criteria. You can select support requests based on the name of the User in charge of answering the SR, the status of the SR and its category, if any (in general, these are high level modules or functions of the software).

Like bugs and tasks the selected SRs can be sorted by clicking on any of the labels at the top of the SR report. And they also follow the same color coding schema to show the urgency of a SR. The SR Manager menu also offers 2 shortcuts to quickly select all SRs with status value at Open ("Open Requests" item) and those that have been assigned to you ("My Requests" item). This is mostly for project members.

section.title: Support Request Processing
section.para: Project members that have been granted Administrative rights on the SR Manager can process the submitted SR.

Clicking on the SR ID number in the first column of the result list generated by the SR selection and browsing module brings you to a screen showing all the details of the pointed SR. A Support Request can be viewed as a thread of discussion between CodeX users and the project team. Once a SR has been submitted, the first thing to do for the project team is to assign the SR to a project member and a priority on a scale from 1 to 9 like bugs.

From there the project member can post follow-up comments to the request either to provide an answer or to ask for more details. The interesting point is that the SR Manager allows any CodeX User to post follow-up comments to a given request. Therefore anybody can potentially bring additional information or answer the question.

section.title: E-mail Notification
section.para: The SR Manager has a sophisticated e-mail notification system. Each time a SR is submitted or updated an e-mail notification is sent to the following people:

listitem.para: The SR submitter (the person who initially submitted the SR)
The SR assignee (the project member to whom the SR is assigned)
All the people who have so far contributed a follow-up comment for this SR

The e-mail addresses specified in the "Other Configuration Settings" screen of the SR Administration module (see section ). These e-mail addresses can be any email address you want including a distribution list that was created with the CodeX Mailing List manager () or via MS-Exchange.

section.para: The e-mail notification consists of the SR ID number, SR summary, SR original description as well as all SR fields, plus all follow-up comments sorted by date (most recent first).

section.title: Support Request Manager Administration
section.para: Project members that have been granted Administrative rights on the SR Manager can configure the SR Manager.

section.title: Defining Support Request Categories
section.para: The SR Manager allows you to define SR categories. To add or modify SR categories click on the "Admin" item in the SR Manager menu at the top of the screen (). SR categories generally reflects the high level modules or functionalities of your software. It is a convenient way to classify your support requests and make the SR processing easier for your team.

section.title: Defining Canned Responses
section.para: Beside Categories, the Administration module of the SR Manager Canned Response are pre- defined responses that you can write down once for all and later re-use in the SR management process. They generally correspond to the type of follow-up comment that SR managers uses on a regular basis like a "thanks for posting a SR" message or a request for more information that are very often missing in the submitted SR.

section.title: Other Configuration Settings
section.para: This SR Manager configuration module allows you to define the following configuration parameters:

listitem.para: An introductory message that we'll show up at the top of the SR submission form. This is a convenient way to give directions and recommendations to the SR submitter. The text must use HTML tags for formatting which gives a great flexibility to shape the content of this preamble (you can use bold, italic, embed URL...)

A series of comma separated email addresses to which new SR submission and patch updates will be sent. If you want a (group of) person to be systematically aware of new item submission you can add his/her e-mail address in this text field. Checking the "Send on all updates" check box will cause e-mail notification to be sent on all updates in addition to the initial submission.
